Immersive story

This game is praised by critics and players. I recommend this game to those who follow stories that have an in-depth character development, action/RPG elements, along with the buggiest games on the PC. Now I spent more time trying to get the game to function properly and once I did I just wanted nothing but more Bioshock. I played the original Bioshock and I skipped the sequel since the only thing has changed was the protagonist and not the gameplay making it feel like I was drinking the same soda from a different glass. Bioshock Infinite had both a different flavor and glass container since the engine changed; there is a lack of the bottom of the ocean, and more fast-paced action. Now the ONLY thing that I warn to those who are going to buy it, it’s buggy, like really buggy. For example, while being under suppressive fire from the enemy my shield will go down then suddenly the computer freezes. If there was one thing in the world that can make me not pick up a game for months it would be that bug. Crashing my computer for fancy particle effects makes me want to get a hammer and smash the game.  BEWARE OF THE BUG! The only way I managed it was by lowering the graphics to the lowest I can then once it autosaved then I bump it back up (since there are only certain sections of the game that did this to me). In conclusion take caution when making this purchase, other than that get it.

great game ! after the 30 min of slow walking and talking in the breath taking scenery you enjoy great combat with fun to shoot at enemies, mixing in challenging drones and sentries allows for the combat to be difficult yet satisfying. Amazing price now that on sale and with trilogy you will have hundreds of hours of fun.

The beautiful world,  captivating plot, and scarier than shit moments keep you on the edge of your seat all game long wanting to keep playing past the auto save check points. Didn't even play the other two but this game is one hell of a ride, the whole way through. 10/10!

BioShock Infinite – это самая лучшая игра, за последние годы.
Здесь невероятно интересная и захватывающая история, которую трудно забыть.
Отличный игровой процесс, замечательный дизайн, невероятно захватывающая атмосфера.
В игре отлично продуманные персонажи, чьи истории так же интересны как и у Букера с Элизабет. 
Отдельно хочется отменит Элизабет, она прекрасна. Интересный и очень красивый персонаж. На протяжение всего путешествия по Колумбии вы будете всё больше привязываться к Элизабет.

Оценка: 10/10
22.4 hours later. i want more.

This has become my favorite game of all time.  It isn't perfect.  The combat can be a little off at times.  Every once in a while there's a segment of gameplay or level design that is off just a little.  But the overall aesthetic of the game is, to me, perfection.  The setting is amazing.  The art direction is flawless.  The music is perfect.  The story is great.  Fully recommended for anyone.

Bioshock Infinite is an odd case for me.
After walking away from it, I felt like it wasn't very good. I remember only the bad parts of it,
things like the unsatisfying story ending, or the unexplainable super powers (I get why they are there, they are plasmids. But they feel like they are just /there/.)

However, I then remember I played through it 4 times, and how I'm still playing it.
So it must be fun.

10/10 would reccomend.

BioShock Forever is the sequel to Shadow Nukem: New York Secret Bomb. It really gives Guise of the Wolf a run for it's money.  Now I know Guise of the Wolf was praised for it's excellent story, superb voice acting, and absolutely incredible attention to detail and animation quality, and to be honest, while Biography Electrocute does in fact fall a bit short, this is the ONLY game that even comes close to being as good as Guise of the Wolf. That said, Biology Zapper Tree is still one of the best open-world JRPGs i've ever played. The turn-based combat and driving physics make this game stand out from other JRPGs such as Half-life 2, Puzzler World, and Loony Toons: Back in Action The Video Game.

Bring us the girl and wipe away the debt. Sounds simple right? Bioshock infinite opens with just this simple task. This game is a clean slate for the Bioshock series. Very few ties remain of the original games as infinite creates a whole new perspective. You play as Booker Dewitt, A gun for hire, on a mission to clear his name. You are quickly whisked away to the floating world in the clouds. Columbia appars to be a perfect utopia on the outer skin. As the game progresess you begin to lear more and more as the questions begin to pile up. As far a story goes I find little to compair. The writing and characters are all very well done. The graphics on the right machine can be beautiful. The complicated backrounds and buys sets are a feast for the eyes. The gameplay is diffirent yet much of the same. Gunplay is like most shooters and the new vigor potions provide a special balance to the game without seeming too overpowered. By the time this game has ended you will be a changed person. The ending is unlike any other i've experienced in a fps. All of the elements combined make one of the best gaming experiences I have has the pleasure to play. And the 1999 hard mode and extenstve DLC will satisfy the hungry Bioshock fan. So what are you waiting for. Dive in to this game and prepare to be amazed

I'd say if you really enjoy amazing storytelling/lore, unique gameplay, killer mechanics, a fun time, and overall quality game: Invest in Bioshock Infinite.

Remember, it's single player...and probably the best experience ever as one too.
If you don't play this, just throw your PC away..................
Bioshocks always will amaze me how great they are done.

An amazing and fantastic game. I could praise this game in many areas.

The story is probably my favourite game story of all time, and although it seems very confusing throughout the game, the ending wraps it up in an exceedingly satisfying way.

The visuals were also fantastic, and they even looked good on lowest setting (because my computer is not good for gaming). The lighting and the game setting absolutely blew me away too.

The only criticism I have about this game is it's fairly repetitive game mechanics and difficult gameplay. But overall, it is a fantastic game and I recommend this to anyone and everyone.

Après avoir adoré le premier Bioshock et avoir été déçu par le deuxième, je me plonge quelques années plus tard dans ce troisième volet, dont j'ai eu des échos très différents.

Tout d'abord, j'ai été ravi de constater que le jeu reste toujours dans le style du premier. Un megalomane complétement cinglé construit une cité "parfaite" et très spéciale. Après les profondeurs de l'océan, on se retrouve littéralement au septième ciel avec une ville de Columbia impressionnante de part sa réalisation! C'est vivant, c'est beau, bref, ça déchire!

Le Gameplay n'est pas en reste, on retrouve à vrai dire les même mécaniques que dans le premier volet.

Le scénario est aussi excellent que celui du premier opus. On commence à comprendre (un peu) au fur et à mesure certains aspects de l'histoire et PAN! Rebondissement! Levé de voile! On reste bouche bée, complétement abassourdi par ce qu'on vient de voir! On se surprend même à ne pas l'avoir vu venir!

Je recommande vivement! Ce Bioshock Infinite est un grand cru!

PS: ça ne vous dispense pas de faire le premier!
Really amazing game I liked the story and the garphics as well .

O jogo com a trama mais envolvente que ja joguei!

This game grew on me like no other except Ocarina of Time. Game mechanics may be seem broken but this game is a one of a kind masterpiece, as the narratives really drives you into to ending and when it ends it astonishes you and you keep wondering for a week or two WTF just happened and why you are not playing anymore. Then you play and re-play to the extent of checking every corner just to be in awe with the art direction and awesome sound track. God only knows why there are people around who like to bash a game that will be remembered as long as the gaming industry endures.

This game definitely imporved much upon the released rapture series, the story is fantastic, difficulty levels provide fantastic flexibillity and I enjoyed the optional quest items you could find in many different places. Although I haven't tried the burial at sea episodes, I can already tell that from everything good about Infinite so far burial at sea will be just as fantastic. Bioshock returning to its roots in Rapture is always nice :)

Excelente jogo, com excelentes gráficos e uma dificuldade razoável. As vezes o mapa é tão complexo que você se perde, tendo que gastar algum tempo para se localizar novamente. A trilha sonora também é o ponto forte, dando um outro nível ao jogo.
A inteligência artificial também é muito boa, levando você a "suar" para passar por alguns "chefes" e situações.
Vale a pena se você gosta de uma boa ação e uma boa história. Mais que recomendado!

Bioshock Infinite was an extremely hyped game, but I believe that it did an excellent job of living up to the high expectations. While my largest complaint is that the game seemed far too short, I truly enjoyed the experience while the story lasted. The artstyle of the game is beautiful, and I find the storyline to be both engrosing and well-written. The Bioshock series has done a wonderful job of setting the scene for a dystopia; whether you are dragged down into the depths of Rapture, or floating high in the brilliant skies of Columbia, life is not as it seems.

As someone who enjoys an intricately woven story and engrossing characters, I thoroughly enjoyed playing through Bioshock Infinite.
O melhor enredo já criado para um game! E arrisco dizer um dos melhores da história do entretenimento. Vale cada centavo.

Infinite is a wonder of inspired design, beautiful setting, and commerical compromises. Worth buying, playing, and then arguing about and wishing for more. Form your own opinions about the game's politics. 

Play the DLC as well to really see what they were trying to do and ponder what they could have done ... and to embrace the full cycle of the Bioshock games and their studio.

Oh, and I've not finished the main storyline as the final? battle was far too obnoxious and poorly scripted. I skipped ahead the to Burial at Sea DLC and have been quite happy with that choice story-wise while Clash in the Clouds is pretty fun (with no story).
Brilliant game, brilliant story, ive never connected to a character as much as I did to Elizabeth. 10/10

"Are you a bad man?" "I am a bad man" "No you're not a bad man." *Killing about twenty people* "Are you a bad man?" "That guy is a bad man." "That guy is a bad man."

Bioshock Infinite wants to be a game about the nature of "what-if" and choice, framed in a story about ex-military officer Booker DeWitt sent to a mystical city in the clouds to rescue the mysterious waif Elizabeth, whose strange world-altering powers and sheltered childhood lends itself to an unfolding narrative of mutual cooperation; encouraging the player to care for an NPC as the two of you battle an unjust world out to get you.

What it *is*, is a game about shooting dudes in the face. Lots of them, in hectic combat where you tend to get disoriented a lot and your low health and lack of carriable healing items causes you to run around from cover to cover like a headless chicken looking for that precious popcorn or abandoned soda to boost your all-too-fragile health. And when the red mist is over you are left with a pile of dead police officers and ordinary, well-intentioned people convinced you are a bad guy. Which, after having killed about twenty of them, you kind of sort of feel like. Racists they may be, but nothing in-game ever convinced me these people *needed* to die, and especially not in such crude, gore-tastic manners.

Bioshock Infinite has a real issue with story-and-gameplay integration: The story and presentation leaves me ill-motivated to care about the main characters or anything they do. The gameplay, even if it had been better (it is certainly the weakest of the Bioshock games to date, sacrificing the last vestiges of System Shock on the altar of Call of Duty) creates a sharp divide between the themes of caring for someone and cooperating with them and killing endless hordes of very human cannon fodder with nary a thought; apparently only the hopes and dreams of the main character are worth diving into. Booker's dismissing of practically everything about this magical cloud wonderland he finds himself in, or his refusal to engage in any form of self-reflection about himself or his actions, certainly don't help matters.

In fact, if I may be so bold I might say this game's core excellence is as a showpiece for the ideas promoted by Spec Ops: The Line. Do I feel like a hero yet? No, Bioshock Infinite. No, I do not.
Really great visuals and gameplay. I haven't finished it yet, but I'm loving it so far!
buy it!

Kvalitní průměrná Ačková hra s překvapivě dobrým koncem.

Co je hlavní předností hry je výtvarná stránka (level-design). Opravdu pěkně zpracovaný živoucí svět (živoucí v rámci lineární hry).
Je zde spousta detailů jako hry na pouti atd. Dále vedlejší úkoly a další věci pro prohloubení příběhu jak už to u Bioshocku bývá video-logy...
Bohužel tím přednosti končí. Je to konzolová hra takže to trpí klasickou konzolovostí ale tím trpí všechny díly Bioshock, takže se s tím musí počítat.

1) Ještě musím pochválit hru že není zabugovaná. Jen jednou se mi stalo že jsem propadl texturou,

2) Hratelnost. Ta je vyloženě slabá. A.I. je sice agresivní ale tupá. Obtížnost i na extra 1999 mód je triviální. Pokud vás bavilo vylepšení zbraní, plazmidů atd. v předchozích dílech tak tady vás to bavit nebude. Ztratilo to svoji extravaganci a logičnost. Zbraní je dost ale jsou nemastné neslané stejně jako pocit střelby z nich. Prostě bude střílet s tím co se válí na zemi. Co se týče interaktivity s prostředím tak je to velice kontroverzní. Každopádně je to mnohem lepší než ve většině dnešních her.
Co se týče ovládání. Je to Unreal engin takže není problém si projet configy a změnit si co chcete.

3) Příběh. Jak jsem nakousl tak mě překvapil konec. Aji vás překvapí. Začátek je taky dobrý. Ale mezi tím se to trochu zadrhává. Ne že by bylo málo scénáře nebo byl vyloženě špatný. Je to spíše problém v logičnosti. Scénář je psán typicky svým stylem a mnohdy působí originálním dojmem ale zdá se mi jako by byl mnohdy vytržen z kontextu. Je zde mnoho nakousnutých věcí které končí brzo v zapomnění protože nejsou dále rozvíjeny nebo rychle končí (nemají další smysl pro příběhovou linii).

4) Technická stránka grafiky. Už jsem tak dnes oťukaný od těch multiplatformních her a dnešních rádoby nex-gen her že se mi příčí to zhodnotit negativně, ale tu objektivnost a logika být musí. Je to lepší než předchozí díly bez pochyb. Ale prosím aby hra roku 2013 vypadala hůře než hry z roku 2007 není v pořádku. Dnes každá hra těží z jediného efektu a to post-processing. Bez něj by totiž vypadali mnohdy hůře než hry z roku 2005. Ok ano grafika není jak pěst na oko a je docela pěkná ale oproti tomu co se dá zvládnout technicky je to velice slabé. K tomu připočtěme neadekvátní nároky. O ano já vím i slabší dnešní mainstream to zvládna... O tom to ale není! Jinak hra netrpí mini-lagingem a ani nějakýma FPS propadama. Kdo je šikovný tak si hru dokáže zkrášlit a i dokonce snížit HW nároky. 

5) Herní doba je velice slušná. Myslím že kolem 15cti hodin asi.

6) DLC obsah mi přejde předražený.

7) Zvuky. Namluvení postav je perfektní. (i animace). Samotný zvuk (efekty) tak průměr. Soundtracku jsem si žádného taky nevšiml že bych si nějakou symfonii zapamatoval. Takže neurazí a ani nenadchne.

U této hry se zabavíte ale nic extra od toho nečekejte. Zahrajete a zapomenete. Mno mě zůstala po hře v paměti jen filozofická pointa.
WHAT A TOP KEK
Hands down best game I've played in years. Columbia is one of the most enthralling virtual worlds I've seen in a video game. Rest in peace Irrational Games.
